content.body: anybody interested in picking up the date parsing proposal? https://twitter.com/domenic/status/1701888428244173166
this problem isn't going away on its own
I’d actually plead to leave the problem unresolved and simply declare `Date` as broken.
content.formatted_body: I’d actually plead to leave the problem unresolved and simply declare Date as broken.

content.body: So the canonical solution should be to migrate away from `Date` to `Temporal` instead of patching and modifying existing `Date` behaviour
content.formatted_body: So the canonical solution should be to migrate away from Date to Temporal instead of patching and modifying existing Date behaviour

content.body: Especially as modifying the existing behaviour carries a risk of breaking the Web for anyone that has fixed this issue based on browser identification
(That’s of course just my highly biased 0.02€)
also, it seems like a single project aiming to match another needing to reimplement another engine's date parser, one time, isn't much evidence of it being "needed"
